result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert F. Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo a Psychological Evaluation and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
The defendant is to have NO argumentative/violent contact with M. Graves as named in the complaint.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.   Defendant to complete a Anger Management Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Graves, Robert F.
defendant.address: W8399 County Road O, Wild Rose, WI 54984

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 10:39 am case called. Defendant Robert F. Graves in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over motions filed and questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant wishes to represent himself. Court questions defendant regarding counsel and accepts waiver of right to counsel. Court questions defendant regarding agreement. Statement by defendant regarding DAAP/Anger management. Court finds the defendant has materially breached the agreement. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendfant to EACH COUNT: Impose 90 days WCJ, STAYED placed on probation for a period of 18 months. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served.  CONDITIONS: Psychological exam and follow through, Anger Management and follow through, No argumentative/violent contact with M. Graves, as named in the complaint. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample to be provided. Expungment of DNA through DOJ explained. Appeal Rights Given.
Motion hearing on January 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.
to Vacate Post Plea Diversion Agreement
To Vacate Deferred Sentencing Agreement
Sentencing hearing on January 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.

10:35 am case called. Defendant Robert F. Graves in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Szilagyi defendant is requesting new counsel. No objection by DA Blader. Court allows Mr. Graves to retain new counsel.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.
12 Mos Deferred Sentencing Agreement as to Ct No 2
12 Mos Post Plea Diversion Agreement as to Ct No 1
Sentencing hearing at 12-27-2016 10:30 am

Case Called @ 2:24 PM: Defendant Robert F. Graves in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Ct 2 DC count will be added which will call for a 12 mos Def SEH agreement.  As to Ct 1 - counsel will offer a 12 mos PPDA with dismissal if successful.    Def and counsel confirms State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA as to Ct 1and Deferred SEH agreement as to Ct 2. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (Misd Batt):  NC  Accepts State's Motion to add to the Complaint the offense DC and adds that charge Plea Ct 2: NC DC:  Court accepts pleas and stays JOC as to Ct 1.  12 mos PPDA accepted.  JOC entered as to Ct 2.  Court withholds Sentencing as to Ct 2 and accepts Deferred SEH agreement.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 mos.  Defendant reminded that bond will continue and to keep COC advised of address.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case Called @ 2:15 PM:  Defendant Robert F. Graves in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.   ADA argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  SPD argues as to bond conditions requested.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
